title: Sven-Goran Eriksson reveals he persuaded Roman Abramovich to buy Chelsea rather than Tottenham
text:
Former England boss Sven-Goran Eriksson has revealed he encouraged Roman Abramovich to buy Chelsea instead of Tottenham in 2003, after mistaking the Russian for a driver at their first meeting.

Eriksson told the Russian billionaire he would be more successful in west London as he would 'have to change the whole team' in order to win trophies with Spurs.

However, the Swede almost ruined his chances of befriending Abramovich after mistaking him for a chauffeur in 2003, just months before he became Blues owner.

Ex-England boss Sven-Goran Eriksson says he persuaded Roman Abramovich to buy Chelsea

THE ABRAMOVICH ERA Major Trophies: 16 Premier League: 5 Champions League: 1 Europa League: 2 FA Cup: 5 League Cup: 3

Recalling their first encounter, Eriksson told The Times: 'We met at Les Ambassadeurs (a casino in London).

'There were three men standing there. One is properly dressed, the other is so-so and the third, I thought he was the driver. Of course that was Roman.

'He wanted to buy a club in Moscow so we went to Moscow for three days. We saw all the clubs and I said buy Dinamo. They had the best facilities.

'I went on holiday and his right-hand man phoned. Roman changed his mind. He wants to buy a club in London.

The Russian billionaire opted to buy the Blues instead of Tottenham or Dinamo Moscow

'Tottenham or Chelsea? I said, "What does he want to do?" He said he wants to win.

'I said, "So buy Chelsea. You have to change half the team. Tottenham you have to change the whole team."'

The pair remain friends and Chelsea have won 16 major trophies, including five Premier League titles, in the 16 years following Abramovich's takeover.

Meanwhile, Tottenham have won one trophy in that time, lifting the League Cup in 2008.
